intro: Iridorkis pyrulifera, commonly known as the flameleaf orchid, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It features vibrant, flame-like petals that range in color from deep red to orange, making it a popular ornamental species. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters along its stems. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a favorite among horticulturists and plant enthusiasts.
